page.title: 04Gt.Orme-Sea Cliffs-Ecology
page.content: The Great Orme{limestone cliffs}have many ledges which provide a habitat for the{Common Bent Grass}and{Red {Fescue.}One can usually see yellow flowered{Wild Cabbage, }white {Scurvy {Grass,}pink{Thrift}as well as {Ox-Eye} {Daisy, Rock Spurrey}and{Common Thyme amongst these grasses. One plant unique to Britain is the {Great Orme Berry}or{Wild Cotoneaster. In 1983 there were only six plants, but by today conservationists have grown another five. On the cliffs there are many safe nesting places for sea birds. One thousand pairs of{kittywakes}have been recorded, as well as{guillemots,shags, {razorbills}and{cormorants}.One of the Welsh names for cormorants is "Llanc- iau Llandudno" trans."The lads of Llan -dudno".There are also 100 pairs of Fulmars,first nesting recorded in 1930
